LAW-ABIDING.Definition: obeying the law, not breaking rules

CRITICS.Definition: people who express unfavourable opinions of it

INHUMANE.Definition: cruel or not kind to others

RATIONAL.Definition: thinking in a clear, logical way

WELL-ADJUSTED.Definition: normal, healthy, and comfortable in life

ORIENTATION.Definition: a meeting or training to explain what to do

BATONS.Definition: long sticks that are carried by guards or police

ARREST.Definition: the action of taking someone into custody because they may have broken the law

HANDCUFFED.Definition: had their hands tied with special metal cuffs or rings

FINGERPRINTED.Definition: had the patterns of their fingers taken for identification

BLINDFOLDED.Definition: had a cloth or something over their eyes to stop them from seeing

BLINDFOLDS.Definition: cloths or objects used to cover their eyes

SPRAYED.Definition: covered with liquid from a spray

DELOUSING.Definition: cleaning or treating to get rid of lice or bugs

HUMILIATING.Definition: making them feel very ashamed or embarrassed

SMOCKS.Definition: simple clothing, like a loose shirt, usually worn for a special purpose

NYLON STOCKING.Definition: a thin, stretchy material used for clothing, like tights or socks

ANKLES.Definition: the parts of their body where the feet connect to the legs

INTENTIONAL.Definition: done on purpose, not by mistake

STRIPPED.Definition: made them take off all their clothes

PUSH-UPS.Definition: a type of exercise where you lie on the ground and push your body up and down using your arms

SOLITARY CONFINEMENT.Definition: being kept alone in a small space as punishment

DEGRADING.Definition: making them feel very bad about themselves

UNLEASHED.Definition: let out, or allowed to be free

MENTAL BREAKDOWN.Definition: a time when he became very upset or lost control of his thoughts and feelings

REASSERT.Definition: take control again or make sure their power was clear

SINGLED THEM OUT.Definition: chose them from the group and focussed on them

TURN ON EACH OTHER.Definition: start attacking or fighting one another

PARANOIA.Definition: a feeling that others were trying to harm or deceive them, even if it was not true

SUSPICIOUS.Definition: having or showing a cautious distrust, doubtful

CHAINS.Definition: metal links used to tie them

JEALOUSY.Definition: feeling upset because they wanted what others had

BREAKDOWN.Definition: a time when he became very upset or lost control of his thoughts and feelings

CORRECTIONAL OFFICER.Definition: the guard who kept order and made sure rules were followed

OVERWHELMING.Definition: too much to deal with, very strong or big

BEGGED.Definition: asked for it very urgently or desperately

STEP IN.Definition: become involved in the situation to help him

WAKE-UP CALL.Definition: a sudden event that made him change his behaviour

BLURRED.Definition: made unclear or difficult to see

UNETHICAL.Definition: not morally right, wrong in terms of behaviour

PRISON WARDEN.Definition: the person in charge of the prison

SUBMISSION.Definition: the act of obeying or allowing yourself to be controlled by others

RATIONALISE.Definition: explain it in a way that makes it seem reasonable, even if it's not

CONCENTRATION CAMPS.Definition: places where large numbers of people were forced to stay under harsh conditions

ENCOURAGED.Definition: made them feel like they should do it

LIVE UP TO.Definition: try to be as good as expected or hoped for

ETHICS.Definition: moral rules or principles that guide behaviour

ETHICAL.Definition: following the rules of right and wrong

TRAUMA.Definition: strong emotional shock or experience that caused lasting damage

DEFINITIVE.Definition: final and complete, not open to change

INSTITUTIONS.Definition: large organisations or systems that have a big impact on society
